oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Oklahoma Roundup Rehearsal - 1946-10-26 - KOMA - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Rehearsal from the Oklahoma Roundup radio program on October 21, 1946 on radio station KOMA (Oklahoma City, Okla). Staff includes Hiram Higsby (master of ceremonies, writer), Allan Page (announcer, director), and Kenyon Brown (producer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chuck Davis; Roundup Boys; Mary Lou; Hiram Higsby; Homegrown Trio; Ann Bond
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Opening statements and theme / (1:28) Hiram Higsby introduces the next song / (1:43) Chuck Davis and the Roundup Boys perform "By The Sea" / (2:47) Hiram Higsby, Allan Page, and Chuck Davis tell a joke through a skit / (3:45) Mary Lou performs "I Want To Be A Real Cowboy Girl" / (6:20) Hiram Higsby and Allan Page tell a joke / (6:40) Hiram Higsby performs "Since We Put A Radio In The Henhouse" / (8:40) Hiram Higsby and Allan Page tell a joke / (9:36) The Homegrown Trio perform "Columbus Stockade Blues" / (11:41) Hiram Higsby and Ann Bond tell a joke / (12:17) Ann Bond performs "In A Little Old Hillbilly Town" [unconfirmed] / (14:31) Hiram Higsby and Lem Hawkins tell a joke [incomplete]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Oklahoma Roundup; KOMA (Radio station : Oklahoma City, Okla.); CBS Inc.; Davis, Chuck; Higsby, Hiram, 1909-1975; Bond, Ann;
